entry.title: SpiderJS üï∑ | V8 Engine and JIT Compilation
entry.summary:
V8 Engine and JIT Compilation: Powering JavaScript Performance
1. History of JavaScript Interpretation and Performance Challenges
JavaScript, launched in 1995 by Brendan Eich at Netscape, was designed to bring interactivity to web pages, such as form validation or simple animations. As an interpreted language, it executed code line-by-line without pre-compilation, which suited the basic web applications of the 1990s. Back then, web pages were static, and JavaScript‚Äôs role was limited to client-side scripting in browsers like Netscape Navigator. By the 2000s, web applications grew complex, incorporating real-time features and rich interfaces. JavaScript also expanded beyond browsers to server-side platforms (Node.js), mobile apps (React Native), and desktop apps (Electron). Thi‚Ä¶

entry.title: DevLog #2: Signals Part I
entry.summary:
Table Of Contents
"Send me a Signal" EventManager Class Add a Listener Triggering a Signal Queuing a Signal Remove a Listener The Complete Code What's Next? If you're an old fart like me, you'll probably remember a line from a Chris de Burgh song released in 1982: "Ship to shore, answer my call, Send me a signal, a beacon to bring me home." What does this have to do with game development? Well, the first thing I code in any game I make is a form of the Observer pattern. It allows you to send signals to trigger events in different parts of your game engine without actually calling the code directly. NOTE: This technique is only useful in fire-and-forget type situations. If you need a response from your call, you shouldn't use this method. Don't get trapped in the situation where yo‚Ä¶

entry.title: The Rise of Quantum Computing and Its Future Applications
entry.summary: Discovering the Magic of Quantum Computing Imagine a computer so smart it can solve puzzles faster than you can blink! That‚Äôs what quantum computing is‚Äîa new kind of computer magic that‚Äôs changing the world. Unlike the computers we use for games or homework, quantum computers use the strange and exciting rules of quantum physics, the science of tiny things like atoms. These computers don‚Äôt just work faster; they think in a whole new way! In this blog, we‚Äôll explore what makes quantum computing special, how it‚Äôs already helping people, and what it might do in the future. Get ready for a fun adventure into a world where computers act like superheroes, solving problems that seem impossible! What Is Quantum Computing? Qubits are super cool because they can be 0, 1, or both at the same time! Th‚Ä¶

entry.title: Understanding Abstraction in Java.
BudgetBuddy: A Simple Expense Tracker Made Easy with Amazon Q Developer
entry.summary:
This is a submission for the Amazon Q Developer "Quack The Code" Challenge: Exploring the Possibilities BudgetBuddy is a minimalist expense tracker built with React. It lets users add and delete expenses‚Äîsimple, clean, and functional. Created with help from Amazon Q Developer to speed up development and reduce repetitive coding. üé• Watch the video demo üì∑Screenshot
BudgetBuddy - Simple Expense Tracker üí∏ üîó View the GitHub Repository After installing and setting up Amazon Q, I only asked for help in creating a simple expense tracker using React, utilizing a list object to ensure no API is involved in data manipulation.
I was surprised when Amazon Q Developer asked, 'Allow this action?'‚Äîcurious about what would happen next.
After I allowed the action, I was honestly surprised‚Äîit didn‚Äôt just show me some code, it actually created real files in my project.
For finalization, since the code and files were already generated, all I did was refine some parts of the code provided by Amazon Q. I created a React project using Vite, integrated the recommended code, and ran it. That‚Äôs it‚Äîit was surprisingly easy to build with Amazon Q Developer.

entry.title: Get Hands-On with Red Hat Linux: Set Up Your Ultimate Practice Lab
entry.summary:
Introduction
Before working with Red Hat Linux commands, you need a practice environment where you can experiment safely. Whether using a local Linux terminal, a virtual machine, or a dedicated system, setting up an environment ensures you can explore Linux without affecting your main system. If you already have Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) installed, the terminal is your main tool for executing commands. To open the terminal: Press Ctrl + Alt + T or search for Terminal in the applications menu.
Start typing commands directly to interact with the system.
If you don‚Äôt have RHEL installed yet, you can download the ISO file and install it on your system. üëâ Download Red Hat Enterprise Linux: Red Hat Download Page If you prefer running Red Hat Linux without installing it on your main computer, using a virtual machine (VM) is a great option. Install Virtualization Software VMware Workstation Player: Download Here
Oracle VirtualBox: Download Here
Download Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) ISO Register for a free Red Hat Developer Account:
Visit the Red Hat Developer Program.
Create an account (free for individual developers).
Sign in and access the RHEL Download Page:
Download RHEL ISO
Choose the latest version and save the ISO file.
Set Up the Virtual Machine Open VMware Workstation Player or Oracle VirtualBox.
Create a new virtual machine, selecting the RHEL ISO as the installation media.
Follow the setup instructions to install RHEL in a virtual environment.
Once the VM is up and running, you can start practicing Red Hat Linux commands without modifying your main system. Setting up a Red Hat Linux practice environment ensures safe learning and experimentation. Whether using the built-in terminal, a virtual machine, or a dedicated system, having a proper setup makes mastering Linux commands easier. Ready to start practicing? Set up your environment today! üöÄüíª

entry.title: DIY Smart home project: Presence-activated lights
entry.summary:
Background
I got these Antela smart bulbs a while ago. They connect to my home network, and I control them from my phone via either the Tuya Smart app (Tuya is a Chinese IoT service provider) or Google Home. I got the smart bulbs rather than smart switches because they allow me to customize the brightness and colour, a feature I found helpful when my eyes were super sensitive to light after surgery. I also recently began to use Home Assistant. Think of it as an open-source and more powerful alternative to Google Home/Amazon Alexa/Apple HomeKit/Samsung SmartThings. With those vendor platforms, you're limited to what they support. With Home Assistant, you can build your own setups and connect things as you wish, whether it's totally DIY or consumer-ready products from vendors. I recently g‚Ä¶

We also explored the world of open-source software and much more! For a deeper dive into these topics, check out my last article here and this week, we are exploring CSS. Join me, let‚Äôs dive in.

O primeiro sucesso digital foi Pong (1972), lan√ßado em 1972 pela Atari: basicamente um "t√™nis de mesa" virtual, dois jogadores controlam raquetes verticais e devem rebater uma bola em linha reta; deixar passar √© ponto para o oponente. entry.title: Endpoint Security: A Low-Cost Data Diode
entry.summary: You‚Äôve installed all security patches and updates on your system. You‚Äôve run a complete system scan with updated antivirus software. You‚Äôve tightened your firewall rules and started a VPN connection. On top of all that, you use a secure messenger with end-to-end encryption (E2EE). Now you can safely chat with your friends and family, right? Well... no. All these measures may still not effectively address threats and operational challenges. For example, end-to-end encryption does not directly mitigate risks at the communication endpoints themselves. Each user's computer can still be hacked to steal their cryptographic keys (enabling a MITM attack) or to simply read the recipient‚Äôs decrypted messages, both in real time and from log files. The following table summarizes some of the weaknesses‚Ä¶

entry.title: White-Label Crypto Exchanges in 2025: Benefits, Trends, and Integration
entry.summary: When developing products and services for the Web3 space, special attention is often paid to creating light and simple solutions, which, during their development and launch stage, take less time and incur less production costs. This includes crypto wallets, NFT marketplaces, and bots for transaction automation. But what about one of the most commonly used and one of the most popular crypto products ‚Äì a crypto exchange platform? As the cryptocurrency landscape continues to evolve, launching a crypto exchange has become more accessible and efficient, thanks to white-label solutions. In 2025, these platforms offer businesses a swift entry into the market without the complexities of building from scratch. In today's article, Evercode Lab will cover the most interesting topics about this well-‚Ä¶

entry.title: Connecting S3 and Postgres: Automatic Synchronization Without ETL Pipelines
entry.summary:
Modern applications need data that's both accessible and fast. You have data in S3, but transforming it into usable insights requires complex ETL (extract-transform-load) pipelines. With our new livesync for S3 and pgai Vectorizer features, Timescale transforms how you interact with S3 data.
Our new features offer distinct approaches to working with S3 data: Livesync for S3 brings your structured S3 data directly into Postgres tables, automatically synchronizing files as they change. pgai Vectorizer leaves documents in S3 but generates searchable embeddings and metadata in Postgres, connecting unstructured content with structured data for RAG, search, and agentic applications. Both eliminate complex ETL pipelines, letting you work with S3 data using familiar SQL. S3 is where countless org‚Ä¶

entry.title: Plume CEO questions $21B RWA market size, says institutions not ready
entry.summary: Amid the intensifying global race to tokenize real-world assets, the market is still too nascent for institutional adoption, according to Chris Yin, the co-founder and CEO of Galaxy-backed RWA platform Plume. Institutional capital is yet to enter the RWA market, and it will take some time for institutions to see its value, Yin told Cointelegraph on the sidelines of Token2049 in Dubai. ‚ÄúThese things move incredibly slowly, you have to show value, you have to show adoption first,‚Äù Yin said, comparing RWA‚Äôs currently developing stages with the early days of Bitcoin (BTC) and stablecoins. ‚ÄúOnly now, 10 years later, are they beginning to think about using the stablecoin. The same thing is going to happen in tokenized assets or tokenization,‚Äù Yin said. Tokenized RWAs are far smaller than $21 bil‚Ä¶

entry.title: Google subpoena scam: What it looks like and how to avoid it
entry.summary:
What is a Google subpoena scam?
The Google subpoena scam is a type of phishing attack where fraudsters impersonate Google to create a false sense of urgency and fear.¬† Typically, you will receive an email that appears to come from no-reply@google.com, claiming to inform you of a subpoena, a formal legal request. The email will often have a subject line like ‚ÄúSecurity Alert‚Äù or ‚ÄúNotice of Subpoena,‚Äù making it seem urgent and legitimate. These scammers prey on your natural concern about legal matters and data privacy, hoping to trigger a reaction. Inside the email, the scammers falsely claim that Google has been served with a subpoena requiring the company to turn over your account data, such as emails, documents or search history. The email will the‚Ä¶

entry.title: Morgan Stanley eyes crypto rollout for E*Trade platform: Bloomberg
entry.summary: Banking giant Morgan Stanley reportedly plans to list cryptocurrencies on its E*Trade investment brokerage and trading platform. According to a May 1 Bloomberg report, the firm intends to list crypto assets on E*Trade in 2026. The plan is still in early development, and the bank is said to be exploring partnerships with established crypto firms to power the service. Internal discussions about cryptocurrency support reportedly began in late 2024. E*Trade homepage. Source: E*Trade This would not be Morgan Stanley‚Äôs first exposure to digital assets. The bank‚Äôs wealthiest clients have had access to crypto exchange-traded funds (ETFs) and futures for some time, with the firm‚Äôs advisers allowed to pitch Bitcoin ETFs since August 2024. Related: Morgan Stanley to explore crypto offerings for clien‚Ä¶

entry.title: MultiBank, MAG, Mavryk ink world‚Äôs largest $3B RWA tokenization deal
entry.summary: MultiBank Group, the world‚Äôs largest financial derivatives institution based in Dubai, has signed a landmark $3 billion real-world asset (RWA) tokenization agreement with United Arab Emirates (UAE)-based real estate giant MAG and blockchain infrastructure provider Mavryk. The deal represents the largest RWA tokenization initiative globally to date and highlights the upcoming launch of MultiBank‚Äôs native utility token, MBG, according to a press release shared with Cointelegraph. The partnership will bring MAG‚Äôs ultra-luxury real estate projects ‚Äî including The Ritz-Carlton Residences, Dubai, Creekside and the Keturah Reserve ‚Äî onto the blockchain via MultiBank.io‚Äôs regulated RWA marketplace. Once tokenized, these assets will be available to global investors and will generate daily yield for‚Ä¶

entry.title: Eric Trump: USD1 will be used for $2B MGX investment in Binance
entry.summary: Abu Dhabi-based investment firm MGX will use a stablecoin linked to US President Donald Trump‚Äôs family to settle a $2 billion investment in Binance, the world‚Äôs largest cryptocurrency exchange. The World Liberty Financial USD (USD1) US dollar-pegged stablecoin was launched by the Trump-associated crypto platform World Liberty Financial (WLFI) in March 2025. MGX will use the USD1 stablecoin for its $2 billion investment in the Binance exchange, according to an announcement by Eric Trump during a panel discussion at Token2049 in Dubai. Trump, the son of the president, serves as executive vice president of the Trump Organization. Source: Cointelegraph MGX announced its investment in Binance on March 12, marking the first institutional investment in the exchange and one of the biggest funding ‚Ä¶

entry.summary: Crypto exchange MEXC has announced a $300 million ecosystem development fund aimed at supporting Web3 projects over the next five years. The initiative, unveiled at Token2049 in Dubai, is designed to support early-stage blockchain technologies, public chains, wallets, and decentralized tools critical to shaping the future of crypto infrastructure, according to a press release shared with Cointelegraph. Selection criteria for projects looking to participate in the initiative will be announced soon. ‚ÄúWe are committed to strategic investment, focusing not just on exciting ideas and talented developers, but on initiatives with clear long-term potential,‚Äù MEXC chief operating officer Tracy Jin said. She added that the priority is to back projects capable of achieving AAA status within three to ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Restaking can make DeFi more secure for institutional traders
entry.summary: Opinion by: Amitej Gajjala, co-founder and CEO of Kernel DAO The restaking narrative has moved fast ‚Äî from side conversations in validator circles to the forefront of DeFi infrastructure discussions. It‚Äôs not hard to see why. DefiLlama states that major liquid restaking protocols now hold over $12 billion in total value locked (TVL), with dozens of middleware services aligning their security with Ethereum‚Äôs economic base layer. What started as an idea to increase capital efficiency for validators has evolved into a serious attempt to redefine how security is provisioned across decentralized systems. While restaking is gaining momentum among crypto-native participants, institutions ‚Äî the kind with multi-year horizons and regulatory constraints ‚Äî still keep DeFi at arm‚Äôs length. Not because ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Metaplanet to open US arm, plans to raise $250M for Bitcoin strategy
entry.summary: Metaplanet ‚Äî a Japanese company focused on accumulating Bitcoin ‚Äî announced it will launch a United States-based subsidiary. In a May 1 X post, Metaplanet announced that the firm is launching a wholly owned subsidiary in Florida. Furthermore, the new subsidiary is expected to raise up to $250 million of capital to fuel its Bitcoin (BTC) accumulation strategy and tap US institutional investors. In a separate announcement, Metaplanet cites Miami as the city that will host the new subsidiary‚Äôs headquarters. The firm points to Florida as a particularly favorable environment: ‚ÄúFlorida, a rapidly emerging hub for Bitcoin focused companies and financial innovation, recognized for its business-friendly policies and rising status as a global center of capital and technology.‚Äù The company explained ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ethena partners with TON to offer USDe to one billion Telegram users
entry.summary: Decentralized stablecoin platform Ethena has partnered with The Open Network (TON) to make its stablecoins available to Telegram‚Äôs user base of over one billion people. The partnership, announced on May 1 at Token2049 in Dubai, will see the deployment of Ethena‚Äôs USDe (USDE) and Ethena Staked USDe (sUSDe) natively within the TON blockchain. The sUSDe variant will be integrated under the name tsUSDe, enabling Telegram users to access US dollar-denominated savings directly within Telegram. Source: Kirill Malev The deployment involves two major Ethena integrations, including one in the custodial Wallet in Telegram and the second in the TON Space wallet, a self-custodial wallet integrated in the messenger. One of Ethena‚Äôs ‚Äúmost meaningful launches‚Äù Announcing the news on X, Ethena described it‚Ä¶

entry.title: Vitalik Buterin‚Äôs vision for Ethereum: Pectra, Glamsterdam and beyond
entry.summary:
Why do Ethereum upgrades matter?
Ethereum upgrades are essential to scale, secure and evolve the network without compromising its decentralized foundation. Ethereum still stands as the heavyweight of smart contract platforms, but staying on top means relentless reinvention. Every upgrade isn‚Äôt just a technical tweak; it‚Äôs a high-stakes move to crack the toughest problems in crypto: clogged scalability, soaring gas fees, clunky onboarding and the constant creep of centralization. In a race where rivals are slashing transaction times and polishing user experiences, standing still isn‚Äôt an option. To hold its ground at the center of decentralized finance (DeFi), non-fungible tokens (NFTs) and Web3 as a whole, Ethereum must keep sharpening both its exe‚Ä¶

entry.title: Multi-wallet usage up 16%, but AI may address crypto fragmentation gap
entry.summary: Fragmentation and complicated user experience remain two of the most significant obstacles to cryptocurrency‚Äôs mainstream adoption, according to a new industry report. Most users now use at least two wallets to manage their cryptocurrency investments. The¬†lack of interoperability¬†across blockchains means users need to create¬†multiple wallets¬†to interact with different networks, with users having at least two wallets rising by 16% over the past year. According to a research report published by onchain user experience platform Reown and crypto intelligence firm Nansen, 62% of crypto users reported using at least two wallets over the past three months, up from 45% in 2024. More than 18% of respondents said security was their top concern related to wallet use, while 10.6% cited poor user expe‚Ä¶

entry.title: ‚ÄòBad breach of ethics‚Äô ‚Äî Musk echoes crypto execs in backlash against WSJ
entry.summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has lashed out at The Wall Street Journal (WSJ), calling the publication‚Äôs latest report ‚Äúan EXTREMELY BAD BREACH OF ETHICS,‚Äù after it claimed the Tesla board was actively seeking his replacement as CEO. The report, published on April 30, alleged that the board had approached recruitment firms due to concerns over Musk‚Äôs political activity and split focus across multiple ventures. Musk took to X to denounce the article, stating that the WSJ deliberately published false information while knowingly excluding an ‚Äúunequivocal denial‚Äù from Tesla‚Äôs board. Tesla board chair Robyn Denholm also issued a strong rebuttal early Thursday morning, posting on Tesla‚Äôs official X account that the board had not contacted recruiters. ‚ÄúThis is absolutely false,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúThe CEO of Tesla‚Ä¶

Speculation is building that Strategy will announce a major capital raise during its Q1 earnings call on May 1 as it continues to grow its Bitcoin holdings.
Analysts expect a 1% year-on-year revenue bump to $116.6 million, following the firm‚Äôs $120.7 million revenues for Q4 2024.
Michael Saylor‚Äôs Strategy closed April with its highest monthly gain since November, ahead of the firm‚Äôs highly anticipated earnings call on May 1. Strategy (MSTR), formerly known as MicroStrategy, closed April 30 trading at $380.11, a 32% increase from its closing price of $288 on March 31, according to Google Finance data. entry.title: Sam Altman‚Äôs eye-scanning crypto project World launches in US
entry.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman‚Äôs crypto-tied digital identity project World, formerly Worldcoin, has made its US debut in six cities.¬† The project, which aims to verify humans in the age of artificial intelligence, is initially coming to what it calls the ‚Äúkey innovation hubs‚Äù of Atlanta, Austin, Los Angeles, Miami, Nashville and San Francisco, according to an April 30 announcement. World offers a crypto token, Worldcoin (WLD), to those who verify their identity with its spherical device called an Orb, which scans a user‚Äôs face and eyes. The firm had previously skirted launching in the US due to regulatory concerns over offering a token, fears now seemingly allayed with the crypto-friendly Trump administration. The data from World‚Äôs Orb scan can be used to make a World ID on the company‚Äôs platform‚Ä¶

entry.title: Crypto losses spike 1,100% in April with 5th-largest-ever hack: CertiK
entry.summary: Crypto losses spiked by 1,163% over April, with the lion‚Äôs share of lost crypto coming from a single heist of an elderly US individual‚Äôs wallet, says blockchain security firm CertiK. CertiK said in an April 30 X post that a total of $364 million was lost to exploits, hacks and scams in April, jumping from the $28.8 million recorded by CertiK in March.¬† The firm added that white hat exploiters had returned around $18.2 million from exploits on the crypto protocols KiloEx, Loopscale and ZKsync, which brought down the month‚Äôs total. The largest hack in April, and the fifth largest to date, involved an elderly US individual who lost 3,520 Bitcoin (BTC), valued at $330.7 million. The Bitcoin was stolen from their wallet after a hacker used advanced social engineering tactics to gain access on A‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin DeFi will have 300M users, beating Ethereum and Solana: Exec
entry.summary: The first decentralized finance (DeFi) company to launch a user-friendly suite of products on Bitcoin will ‚Äúwin the entire market‚Äù of the blockchain‚Äôs 300 million users, one crypto founder says. Alexei Zamyatin, the co-founder of the Bitcoin layer 2 Build on Bitcoin, told Cointelegraph at Token2049 in Dubai that ‚Äúthe advantage of Bitcoin DeFi is that the market is much bigger, you have a much bigger retail user base that you can tap into.‚Äù ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not easy to convert it, but if you manage to win in Bitcoin DeFi, you win the entire market.‚Äù Zamyatin said the 300 million Bitcoin users would mean DeFi services on the blockchain would ‚Äúoutgrow everything we've seen so far in Ethereum and Solana.‚Äù¬† Build on Bitcoin is one of the firms looking to win market share, offering a hybrid layer 2 solutio‚Ä¶

entry.title: North Carolina House passes state crypto investment bill
entry.summary: North Carolina‚Äôs House of Representatives has passed a bill allowing the state‚Äôs treasurer to invest public funds in approved cryptocurrencies, which will now head to the Senate. The House passed the Digital Assets Investment Act, or House Bill 92, on its third reading on April 30 by a vote of 71 to 44. Republican House Speaker Destin Hall introduced the bill in February, which would allow the treasurer to allocate 5% of the state‚Äôs investments into designated digital assets. The investments can only be made after obtaining an independent third-party assessment confirming that the crypto holdings are maintained with a secure custody solution and risk oversight and regulatory compliance standards are met.¬† New amendments allow the treasurer to examine the feasibility of allowing members of ‚Ä¶

entry.title: Galaxy Digital plans Nasdaq listing as crypto stocks post strong rebound
entry.summary:
Key takeaways:
Galaxy Digital plans to begin trading on the Nasdaq on May 16, pending shareholder and Nasdaq approval.
Nasdaq-listed crypto firms posted strong gains in April after a period of macroeconomic uncertainty.
Galaxy CEO Mike Novogratz says the listing will broaden the company‚Äôs investor base and US presence.
The Toronto Stock Exchange (TSX) listed crypto investment firm Galaxy Digital is set to move to the US-based Nasdaq on May 16, pending stakeholder approval at its upcoming shareholders meeting. Galaxy‚Äôs planned move comes as several Nasdaq-listed crypto firms saw substantial gains in April, following a turbulent few months of macroeconomic uncertainty. Galaxy founder and CEO Mike Novogratz said on April 30 that the listing would be a milestone ‚Äúthat would position us to ‚Ä¶

entry.title: US crypto groups urge SEC for clarity on staking
entry.summary: Nearly 30 crypto advocate groups led by the lobby group the Crypto Council for Innovation (CCI) have asked the Securities and Exchange Commission for clear regulatory guidance on crypto staking and staking services. The CCI‚Äôs Proof of Stake Alliance (POSA) group argued in an April 30 letter to the agency‚Äôs Crypto Task Force lead, SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce, that staking is fundamentally a technical process, not an investment activity.¬† ‚ÄúStaking isn‚Äôt niche ‚Äî it‚Äôs the backbone of the decentralized internet,‚Äù the letter said.¬† The letter responded to the SEC‚Äôs call for public input on whether staking and liquid staking, where crypto users lock up their tokens to earn more, should be regulated under federal securities laws. The coalition called for the SEC to support responsible inclusion‚Ä¶

entry.title: Crypto token failures soar, with 1 in 4 launched since 2021 dying in Q1: CoinGecko
entry.summary: About one in four crypto tokens launched since 2021 have failed in the first quarter of this year amid a crypto market downturn and token creation becoming easier than ever, says crypto data platform CoinGecko. Since 2021, nearly 7 million cryptocurrencies have been listed on CoinGecko‚Äôs token tracking tool GeckoTerminal, and over half, or 3.7 million tokens, ‚Äúhave since stopped trading and are considered failed,‚Äù CoinGecko research analyst Shaun Paul Lee said in an April 30 report. ‚ÄúAlarmingly, the first quarter of 2025 alone saw the collapse of 1.8 million tokens,‚Äù he added, which is ‚Äúthe highest number of failures recorded in a single year.‚Äù It also comprises just under half of all failures and represents a quarter of all tokens launched since 2021. CoinGecko recorded tokens with at lea‚Ä¶

A "falling wedge" is a bullish reversal chart pattern that comprises two converging trend lines that connect lower lows and lower highs. entry.title: Robinhood beats Q1 estimates despite revenue, crypto trading dip
entry.summary: Trading platform Robinhood has still managed to beat Wall Street estimates as its first-quarter revenues fell and its crypto trading volume cooled from a record high in Q4. Robinhood‚Äôs Q1 results shared on April 30 show revenues fell 8.6% from the previous quarter to $927 million, topping Zacks analyst estimates by 3.16%. The company‚Äôs crypto revenue plummeted nearly 30% quarter-on-quarter to $252 million from the firm‚Äôs record-setting Q4 2024.¬†¬† The drop could be partly attributed to the Trump administration‚Äôs tariffs, which triggered an 18% fall in the crypto market cap over the quarter. Crypto trading volume on Robinhood also fell 35% over Q1 compared to the fourth quarter of 2024, which the firm attributed to a 10% drop in customer trades placed and a 27% fall in average notional volum‚Ä¶

entry.title: Solana futures open interest nears all-time high ‚Äî Will SOL price follow?
entry.summary:
Key points:
Solana held the $140 support level for a week, a first in more than two months, highlighting traders‚Äô growing confidence.
SOL futures open interest hit $5.75 billion on April 30, showing strong institutional interest.
With rising DEX volumes and a $9.5 billion TVL, SOL could rally to $200 before a potential spot ETF approval on Oct. 10.
Solana‚Äôs native token, SOL (SOL), fell 4% between April 29 and April 30 after failing to sustain the $150 level. Despite this short-term decline, traders seem more confident as the $140 support remained intact for a whole week, an outcome that hadn‚Äôt happened in over two months.¬† As demand for leveraged SOL positions reached near record highs on April 30, traders are now reconsidering the chances of a SOL rally above $200. entry.title: ‚ÄòTo have freedom of money, you have to have freedom of speech‚Äô ‚Äî CZ
entry.summary: Binance co-founder and former CEO Changpeng ‚ÄúCZ‚Äù Zhao took the stage at Token2049 in Dubai, United Arab Emirates (UAE), where he told the audience that his investment in social media platform X was aimed at protecting freedom of speech. The former Binance executive joined a fireside panel with macroeconomic analyst Raoul Pal to discuss the rationale behind his 2022 investment in X and artificial intelligence. Zhao said: ‚ÄúI think freedom of money is important, but to have freedom of money, you have to have freedom of speech. Freedom of speech is kind of the bottom line. If you don't have that, nothing ‚Äî no other freedom ‚Äî works.‚Äù¬†¬† ‚ÄúSo, when we invested in Twitter back then, it was based on that philosophy,‚Äù Zhao continued. The former Binance CEO also criticized Europe's crypto policies, ch‚Ä¶

entry.summary:
Key takeaways:
Bitcoin bulls are attacking the $95,000 level again after today‚Äôs brief US GDP-induced sell-off.
Traders are semi-agnostic to negative US economic data as they expect the Federal Reserve to resume easing and rate cuts at some point in the future.
Bitcoin (BTC) price knocks on the door of $95,000 after starting the NY trading session with a slight¬†sell-off to $92,910¬†following alarm-raising US GDP data, which showed the economy shrank in Q1 2025. The move mirrors a similar recovery seen in the DOW and S&P 500, which bounced 0.35% and 0.15% respectively at the closing bell.¬† The quick recovery in Bitcoin price highlights the strong bid by a variety of market participants, and it lines up with the view that the April 30 GDP data could be a one-off event resulting from bus‚Ä¶
